intro: Ototropis hayatae, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Ototropis hayatae is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream banks.
